title: [Health] In a search for clues to what may delay or prevent Alzheimer’s disease, scientists report that smarter, more educated people aren’t protected from the disease, but do get a cognitive “head start” that may keep their minds functioning better temporarily

[Cancer] Lung cancer in non-smokers is likely to respond differently to targeted treatments. Since many non-smokers with lung cancer had signs of DNA damage from environmental carcinogens, the study can lead to new treatments for non-smokers with lung cancer tailored to the newly identified genetic changes.
